alert.note: Alert for Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF GRANT, EAST CENTRAL OWEN AND SOUTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located over Dry Ridge, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Morgan, Corinth, Stewartsville, Cherry Grove, Northcutt, Williamstown Lake, Marcus, Twin Bridges, Keefer, Camp Northward, Holbrook, Sherman, Lawrenceville, and Cordova. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
